channel.title: ::item command spawns 2x as much items

item.title: ::item command spawns 2x as much items
item.dc:creator: @zach55200 zach55200
item.description:
@zach55200 wrote:

haksilence:

you say your ::item code is listed twice? identical? remove one. when you type in ::item your server is reading both of those codes and thus performing both of those commands simultaneously. so your basicaly using the command twice every time.

Yeah thats what im thinking, you probably have item command somewhere else in there.

Read full topic

item.title: ::item command spawns 2x as much items
item.dc:creator: @Roar337 Roar337
item.description:
@Roar337 wrote:

[quote=“Alexander-Staneke, post:2, topic:421093”]Maby try another code… Try mine.

[code] }

		if (playerCommand.startsWith("item")) {
			try {
				String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
				if (args.length == 3) {
					int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
					int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
					if ((newItemID <= 20500) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
						c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);		
					} else {
						c.sendMessage("That item ID does not exist.");
					}
				} else {
					c.sendMessage("Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))");
				}
			} catch(Exception e) {
				
			} // HERE?
			} // HERE?[/code][/quote]

lol at first glance there isnt anything wrong with that code he posted which means he has 2x the ::item command in his commands.java

Read full topic

item.title: ::item command spawns 2x as much items
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

rip my command

[code]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”) && c.playerRights >= 2) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Use as ::item 995 200”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

			}
		}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: ::item command spawns 2x as much items
item.dc:creator: @guthix1pker guthix1pker
item.description:
@guthix1pker wrote:

well if i do ::item 14484 1 it spawns 2 d claws, same with ::item 14484 10 it spawns 20, etc it always spawns double

[code=java] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20500) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“That item ID does not exist.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

			} // HERE?
		} // HERE?[/code]

that is my ::item command code, THAT’S ALL THERE IS THERE IS NO BREAK; PART IN IT!

after that another one follows so…
why does it do that?
things i tried: change args[2] to [1], it spawned more d claws than i had inf space

somone help?

btw its a PI
